Alter Planning Co was founded by scottie., a young artist and entrepreneur who grew tired of looking for the perfect planner every year. She crafted each product to help fuel the creativity and productivity of those who used it. 

As an artist, scottie. has a deep understanding of the need for structure and wants to inspire more people to create routines and form in their life.

3.title: Justice for Dominique Fells
3.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

products.name: Coco Loco Body Butter
products.description: Apply to any area of the body as needed. Best used after a shower when skin is still a bit damp. The butters and oils will lock moisture from shower into your skin.

4.title: The Honey Wine Company

products.name: Brut 750ml Honey Wine
products.description: The world standard for premium dry honey wine. Barrel aged in 100% French oak. Crisp, dry, and complex but with no bitter tannins.  Imbibers who enjoy drier cocktails or cider, pilsner style beers, and a variety of grape wine will appreciate versatile "Brut."

products.name: Demi Sec Sparkling 750ml Honey Wine
products.description: The world standard sweeter sparkling honey wine and the world’s first and only Charmat method honey wine (less yeasty and more ‘fruit forward’ than the Champagne method - most perfect for delicate honey wine - especially a sweeter honey wine).

15.title: Does racism affect how you vote?
15.subtitle: Nate Silver has data that answers big questions about race in politics. For instance, in the 2008 presidential race, did Obama's skin color actually keep him from getting votes in some parts of the country? Stats and myths collide in this fascinating talk that ends with a remarkable insight.

16.title: Four-year Analysis: Police-related deaths across racial groups

16.title: Color of Change
16.subtitle: Color Of Change was founded in moments just like this one. As Black communities reeled in grief as all levels of government failed to protect Black people in the wake of Hurricane Katrina, we recognized that not enough of the people and institutions with power over our lives had any fear of disappointing Black people. For the last 15 years, we've focused on building that power.

19.title: Aisha Likes It
19.subtitle:
It began with a problem. I kept looking for the kind of refined, eclectic, Afrobohemian jewelry I really wanted to wear to no avail. Certainly, there was Africa-inspired jewelry available, but much of it lacked the bohemian design aesthetic that fit my taste and style as an African American literature professor. I wanted pieces that could say a lot without doing a lot. My jewelry needed to standout and be distinctive while remaining wearable. I wanted a jewelry wardrobe that reflected my tastes, my passions, my culture, my research interests. And so I began to make my own, sourcing authentic, African diasporic materials, curating and refining my work as my knowledge and skill developed. Eventually, I decided to share my work and Aisha Likes It came into existence.

Aisha Likes it is home to African-inspired jewelry curated towards a bohemian aesthetic created with both ethically sourced materials from throughout the African diaspora and traditional semi-precious stones. Each piece is designed to make a statement at a fair price.

19.title: When the Negro Leagues Played Through the Great Depression and WWII
19.subtitle: The Negro Leagues struggled financially amid systemic racism and segregation—even before the Great Depression disproportionately devastated Black America. But the game's finest days—with transcendent stars like Satchel Paige and Josh Gibson—still lay ahead.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T

20.title: Afro Flow Yoga
20.subtitle:
With over 14 years of experience, Leslie Salmon Jones continues to pursue an active interdisciplinary career in health and dance in Boston and New York City. A Toronto native, Leslie received her B.A. in Dance and Health Studies at the State University of New York, and her Fitness Instructors Certification at New York University. She was a scholarship recipient at the esteemed Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre in New York City as well as the London Contemporary Dance School.

As a professional dancer, Leslie worked with known greats such as Judith Jameson, Bill T. Jones and Wynton Marsalis. At her studio in New York, she developed her own exercise program based on various techniques honed through working with her personal training clientele on a daily basis. Today she continues to divide her time between New York City and Boston.

Leslie has extensive experience in the fitness industry, including being a consultant for the New York Knicks healthy lifestyle clinic that teaches self-esteem to youth. She also served as a board member for the organization, Free Arts for Abused Kids, NYC. Today, she serves as a board member of the United Nations Association of New York

products.name: Tema Turban Headband
products.description: Black, white and red turban headband is lined in black satin to prevent friction between the cotton fabric and your fragile hair strands.  Perfect to wear on your next Peloton ride or wear it casually on your next Zoom meeting with a messy bun. The headband features an elastic band in the back to accommodate various head sizes.

products.name: Luchi Yellow Satin-Lined Headband
products.description: Yellow, espresso, and blue African Printed Head Wrap Headband is lined in black satin to prevent friction between the cotton fabric and your fragile hair strands. Perfect to wear on your next Peloton ride or wear it casually on your next Zoom meeting with a high bun. Get to know the benefits of Satin wraps for hair.

29.title: 13th Amendment
29.subtitle: The 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, ratified in 1865 in the aftermath of the Civil War, abolished slavery in the United States.

29.title: Jarvis Boards
29.subtitle: Jarvis Boards' mission has always been to craft paddle boards in Austin, Texas that are environmentally friendly, look great, and perform well. To accomplish this, we employ a wide range of techniques to craft our small-batch production wooden SUPs in our Austin studio.

products.name: Hollow Core Paddle Board Frame Kits
products.description: There is something magical about creating something with your own two hands. Building your own hollow core paddle board will be one of the most rewarding projects that you'll tackle.

products.name: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hat
products.description: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hats aren't just for dads. This one's got a low profile with an adjustable strap and curved visor. Available in khaki and light blue.

products.name: Surf Wax Candle
products.description: We teamed up with our friends at Jimbo's Surf Wax to create a unique line of surf wax candles. Each candle is slow cooked over a wood stove in Maine using surf wax and a hint of coconut.

30.title: The Black Family in the Age of Mass Incarceration
30.subtitle: By author Ta-Nehisi Coates: Fifty years after Daniel Patrick Moynihan’s report “The Negro Family” tragically helped create this system, it's time to reclaim his original intent.

30.title: All Hip-Hop
30.subtitle:
AllHipHop.com was founded and launched in 1998 by CEO’s "Grouchy" Greg Watkins and Chuck "Jigsaw" Creekmur.

After many years of developing the site, AllHipHop.com has become a valuable resource for hip-hop on the internet, featuring daily news, interviews, reviews, multimedia, a fast growing community and other interesting content.

Publications such as CNN, The Source, XXL, Complex, New York Post, The New York Times and many others cite AllHipHop.com’s news and features due to our accuracy and trustworthiness.

31.title: Frederick Douglass
31.subtitle: Frederick Douglass was an escaped slave who became a prominent activist, author and public speaker.

31.title: Learn about Julius Jones
31.subtitle: Learn about Julius’ life and what led to his wrongful conviction through Viola Davis' docu-series "The Last Defense."
